author: .piersy
content:
Hi <@508125616940515329>, I'm using cast so not setting the chain-id explicitly I assume cast retrieves it from the rpc endpoint. The command I was executing was as follows
```
cast send -r https://rpc.pectra-devnet-6.ethpandaops.io --private-key <key> --value 0.1ether  $ALICE_ADDR
Warning: This is a nightly build of Foundry. It is recommended to use the latest stable version. Visit https://book.getfoundry.sh/announcements for more information.
To mute this warning set `FOUNDRY_DISABLE_NIGHTLY_WARNING` in your environment.

Error: server returned an error response: error code -32000: 0x589acbabb72ae7d7b7fc933dcaa98fc26bab03c3 does not have enough balance to cover transaction costs, need 100021000000273000, but have 0 (insufficient balance)
```
